title: This could be the best picture hanging system ever! 3M Claw
text: I know I might be a little bit late to the party, but this product that's been out a couple of years makes hanging pictures or paintings on plasterboard easy, quick and secure. And I absolutely love it. Just like everyone else, I've spent many years putting in fixings in walls to hold up prints and pictures and paintings to decorate wherever I've been living. And I've lived in quite a few places, so I've done this probably more than the average person. And over the years, I've tried more fixings than I care to remember. And you'll probably recognise some of these. The standard plasterboard fixings are ones that clamp themselves to the back of the plasterboard or even screw themselves into the front. In plastic or aluminium. And lots of different types of adhesive type fixings, although I'm not so keen on these because it really depends on how it adheres to the paint on your walls. And you can never really tell until the thing's fallen off. So I normally end up resulting to a standard Royal Plug and a sort of flat-headed screw that I can hook the cable on the back of the photo or the painting on. And that does the job, but it's not perfect. But recently, I was instructed to put up a few prints around the house, which I just haven't got round to. For the last few years, I've been doing that. So I decided to try something new. And I found a product that's far better than the standard screw and Royal Plug. And it absolutely works a dream. And that's why I'm doing this video.
